weather.description: Current weather data requires real-time access, please check a weather app or website for up-to-date information for London.
weather.recommendation: Dress according to the current weather forecast.

walkability.description: London is generally very walkable, particularly central London.  Many attractions are close together, and there are extensive pedestrian infrastructure and pedestrianized areas.
cons: Can be crowded, especially during peak hours
Not ideal for those with mobility issues for longer distances

transportation_options.weather_impact: Rain or fog can significantly impact driving times and safety.  Snow or ice can make driving very difficult.
cons: Traffic congestion can be severe, especially during peak hours
Parking can be expensive and difficult to find in central London
Congestion charge applies in central London
transportation_options.feasibility: Feasible, but traffic and parking can be major challenges.

transportation_options.weather_impact: Rain, wind, or extreme temperatures can make walking unpleasant or unsafe.
pros: See the countryside at your own pace
cons: Safety concerns walking along major roads for extended periods
transportation_options.feasibility: Not feasible for the entire journey.

transportation_options.weather_impact: Minimal impact, unless there are severe delays due to extreme weather.
cons: Can be crowded during peak hours

transportation_options.estimated_time: 4-6 hours (depending on route and fitness level)
transportation_options.weather_impact: Rain, wind, or extreme temperatures can make cycling unpleasant or unsafe.
cons: Safety concerns sharing roads with traffic
transportation_options.feasibility: Possible for experienced cyclists, but requires planning and preparation. Consider dedicated cycling routes away from major roads where possible.

route_summary.weather_advisory: Please check a weather app or website for up-to-date information for London and Brighton.
route_summary.feasibility_assessment: This route is feasible and a common travel route.

steps.distance: Varies depending on starting point in Brighton
steps.time: Varies depending on starting point in Brighton
steps.notes: Brighton Station is the main railway station in Brighton.

steps.instruction: Board a Southern or Thameslink train towards London Victoria.
steps.notes: Trains depart frequently. Check the departure boards for the next available train to London Victoria.
London Victoria is a major railway and underground station.

recommendations: Purchase your train ticket in advance online or at the station to avoid queues.
Consider using a contactless payment method or Oyster card for travel within London.
Check the train schedule for any planned engineering works or delays.
During peak hours, the train can be crowded. Consider traveling outside of peak times for a more comfortable journey.
safety_concerns: Be mindful of your belongings and surroundings, especially during busy periods.
Take care when crossing roads and navigating platforms, especially in adverse weather conditions.
